III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation - On 5/13/2025 youth was assaulted by other residents.
- Youth was held down while the other residents held a vape to
her face.
- On an unknown date an unknown resident had a marijuana blunt
in their possession.
- The residents in the home continually have access to alcohol.
- Staff is aware of the abuse happening to youth and that the other
residents have access to vapes, marijuana, and alcohol but do not
punish the other residents or confiscate the items from them.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 5/21/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Complainant reported Youth
A is not enrolled in school.
Program Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 5/22/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Program
2

Manager reported she was not aware of any youth at the facility
assaulting Youth A. Program Manager reported Youth A has not
reported any assaults happening to her at the facility. Program
Manager reported youth are not allowed to vape while at the
facility. She said there have been issues regarding vapes as the
youth attend school off grounds and have found ways to obtain
vapes while at school. They conduct daily checks of the youth’s
backpacks when returning from school and room searches when
the youth are out of the building. Program manager reported
Youth C was found with a vape in her drawer during a recent room
search and it was confiscated by staff. She said youth backpacks
are kept in the office after they are searched upon returning from
school daily. Program Manager reported she was not aware of
any incidents where Youth A was held down by peers and a vape
was held to Youth A’s face. Program Manager reported no
knowledge of marijuana being in the home or in the youth’s
possession. Program Manager had no knowledge of a youth
having a “blunt” in the home. She reported at times youth at the
facility will leave the school without permission (skip) then will
obtain alcohol and smoke marijuana. Program Manager reported
Youth B left the facility without permission (AWOLP) and returned
to the facility stating she had obtained alcohol from male
strangers. Program Manager could not recall the date of this
AWOLP incident. She reported this was addressed with Youth B
and Youth B was educated on the dangers of this behavior.
Program Manager reported Youth A informed staff Youth B, Youth
C, and Youth E had vapes and were smoking the vapes. The
facility responded by increasing room searches and trying to
ensure the youth are not bringing items into the facility from
school. Program Manager said Youth A reported Youth B, Youth
C, and Youth E were “peer pressuring” her to vape however Youth
A did not say anything about them holding her down and holding a
vape to her face.
Follow up interview with Program Manager was conducted after
speaking with Youth B. Program Manager reported no knowledge
of any marijuana being found in Staff 1’s car at the facility.
Program Manager reported she was aware Youth B had opened
Staff 1’s car door and looked around in Staff 1’s car however had
no knowledge of Youth B taking anything from Staff 1’s car.
Program Manager reported she believed Staff 1 still worked for
the agency at another facility.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/22/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported no concerns at the facility. Youth B said the youth at the
3

facility get along well and there have been no recent fights
amongst youth. Youth B reported she and Youth E recently went
AWOLP from the facility and went to the store and got snacks.
Youth B reported Youth E asked Youth A and Youth C to go with
them and initially Youth A and Youth C wanted to AWOLP
however decided not to go. Youth B reported youth are not
allowed to vape at the facility. She said no youth at the facility
vape nor did she have any knowledge of staff locating any vapes
in the facility. Youth B reported staff check their backpacks when
they return home from school for “contraband” and explained
“contraband” to be drugs, cellphones, and vapes. Youth B
reported no knowledge of any youth having marijuana at the
facility. Youth B reported she recently obtained a “small blunt” as
she took it out of Staff 1’s car three weeks ago. Youth B reported
Staff 1 no longer works at the facility. Youth B reported Staff 1’s
car was unlocked, and she went in and took the “blunt.” Staff 1
found out and told all the other staff, however Youth B did not
recall who Staff 1 told or which other staff were working when she
took it out of Staff 1’s car. Youth B reported she put the “small
blunt” in her bra and went to bed. Youth B said when she woke
up in the morning the “small blunt” was not in her bra and she did
not know where it was. Youth B reported no other incidents of
marijuana in the facility. Youth B denied having any access to
alcohol at the facility or when AWOLP.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at school on 5/22/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she has
been placed at the facility since 5/12/2025. Youth A reported she
has “concerns about what the youth do in the house”. Youth A
reported all the youth in the house vape in their bedrooms or in
the bathroom. She said youth at the facility go AWOLP to go to
the “drug store and buy drugs”. The staff tell the youth they are not
allowed to vape however they don’t care and do whatever they
want. Youth A said she has never been assaulted by any youth at
the facility, nor did any youth hold her down. She reported Youth
B, Youth C, and Youth E “peer pressured” her into smoking a
vape at the facility by saying “it will be fine, we won’t tell, it won’t
hurt you, don’t tell on us” and “have you ever vaped before.” They
put the vape near her face and she “hit the vape” as she felt “peer
pressured” however was mad at herself for doing it. Youth A
reported youth are not supposed to be in one another’s bedrooms
at the facility but go into one another bedrooms anyways. Youth A
said she did not recall the staff that were working as she is still
trying to learn staff names. Youth A stated it happened the first
full day she was at the facility. She said Youth B has threatened
to beat up staff at the facility and “jack up” their cars. Youth A
4

reported other youth frequently AWOLP at the facility and Youth B
and Youth E were attempting to plan for all the youth to AWOLP
on 5/13/2025 however Youth A reported she did not want any part
in going AWOLP. Youth A said the youth at the facility are getting
vapes while at school. Youth A reported staff try to take the vapes
away from the youth however the youth get them back. Youth A
reported Youth B has taken staff’s keys and gone into the staff
office to “damage property and try to get a vape back”. Youth A
said this occurred on 5/14/2025. Youth A has not seen any
marijuana in the facility. She said Staff 5 told her Youth B had a
“blunt” and “whipped it out” while sitting on the couch once,
however Youth A did not know when this reportedly occurred.
Youth A reported she has not seen any alcohol at the facility
however heard when Youth B and Youth E went AWOLP, they got
“buzz balls” and a marijuana “blunt.” When they came back to the
facility, they “hit the blunt” on the couch. Youth A reported she did
not witness this; she heard this from Staff 5. Youth A reported
when youth come back from school, the staff check their
backpacks for vapes. Youth A reported she does not feel safe at
the facility due to the vaping situation as it brings flashbacks of
when her mom was smoking and vaping and would physically
abuse her.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at school on 5/22/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported the
youth at the facility get along and there have been no recent
assaults. Youth C said she is not aware of any youth, including
Youth A, being held down by other youth. She reported the last
fight at the facility was about a month prior to Youth A coming to
the facility. She said youth are not allowed to vape but her, Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth E do in their bedrooms sometimes when
staff are in the back office. Youth C reported they are not allowed
in one another’s bedrooms at the facility however youth go into
each other’s bedrooms anyway. Staff tell them not to, but they do
not listen. Youth C stated when youth do not follow staff
directions at the facility such as not going into other youth’s
bedrooms, the youth get “fined” meaning their points are taken
consequently. Youth C reported youth get vapes while at school
and bring them back to the facility. Youth C reported staff cannot
do anything because they can’t go “hands on with youth”. Youth
C said staff search youth’s backpacks when they return from
school looking for vapes and complete bedroom searches. Youth
C reported she does not have any vapes at this time. Youth C
said if youth have a vape or staff find a vape while conducting
searches, staff take the vapes. Youth C reported she nor any of
her peers have ever stolen staff keys to get into the staff office.
5

Youth C reported Youth B has broken the staff office door down
previously to assault a staff. Youth C reported Youth B and Youth
E took something out of Staff 1’s car previously however Youth C
did not know what they took. Youth C reported she has never
seen any youth at the house with a “blunt”. Youth C stated she
used to use marijuana when placed at the facility with Youth B,
Youth E, and another youth who is no longer at the facility as the
youth no longer at the facility would get marijuana from people at
school. Youth C reported Youth B, Youth E, and a former youth
got alcohol once while at the organization’s main campus building.
Youth C reported she did not see the alcohol, however Youth B
and Youth E’s breath smelled of alcohol. Youth B and Youth E
were saying they were drunk. Youth C reported this happened
approximately one month ago. Youth C said Program Manager
and Chief Administrator were aware of the situation and stated
Youth B could not go back to the facility’s main campus building.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at school on 5/22/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported the
youth all get along well at the facility. She said she has not
witnessed or heard anything regarding youth holding down any
youth at the facility or fighting. Youth D reported they are not
allowed to vape at the facility however all the youth do except her
and Youth A. Youth D said she witnessed Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth E vaping in their bedrooms while the staff were in the dining
room. Youth D said staff at the facility tell the youth they are not
allowed to vape however the staff are not able to do anything
except take the vapes away. Youth D said the other youth obtain
vapes from school. Youth D reported Youth C currently has a
vape that she keeps in her bra. She said she did not know if staff
are aware that Youth C has a vape. Youth D reported staff search
youth backpacks when they return home from school and
complete room searches at the facility. The staff take any
contraband such as vapes that they find however youth just get
more vapes from school. Youth D reported she is not aware of
any marijuana at the facility. She heard Youth B talking about
marijuana once at the facility, however, did not recall what she
was saying or when it was. Youth D reported Youth B was
throwing up once, unable to recall when, and Youth B was “acting
drunk”. Youth D reported Youth B was saying she got alcohol
while at the facilities main office (not at the facility). Youth D
reported she did not recall which staff were there or what the staff
did. Youth D reported she has never seen alcohol or any youth to
have a “blunt” at the facility. She said Youth B went into Staff 1’s
car and stole Staff 1’s vape. Youth D reported she did not see this
happen however Youth B told her. Youth D reported she never
6

saw the vape Youth B stated she stole from Staff 1’s car. Youth D
reported youth are not allowed in other youth’s bedrooms at the
facility and staff will direct the youth to leave the bedroom however
Youth D said “we don’t listen”.
Youth E was interviewed via telephone on 5/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth E stated she did not
want to talk and requested to leave the interview.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 5/28/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported she has no
knowledge of Youth A being assaulted by any of the youth in the
home. Staff 5 reported Youth A informed her she felt pressured
by Youth B, Youth C, and Youth E to vape at the facility. Staff 5
said Youth A told her she did vape in Youth A and Youth C’s
bedroom, and she felt guilty about it. Staff 5 reported no
knowledge of any youth holding Youth A down and holding a vape
to her face. Staff 5 reported she has never seen any youth vape
at the house, however vapes have been found during bedroom
searches and in youth backpacks upon youth returning from
school. Staff 5 reported when youth return from school, staff
check youth’s backpacks, have youth take their shoes off, check
youth pockets, and have youth pop their bras to ensure youth do
not have anything on them that is not allowed at the facility. Staff 5
reported youth are not allowed to vape at the facility and staff
complete searches of the youth and their bedrooms. Staff 5
reported if a vape is found at the facility, the vape is taken, an
incident report is written, the supervisor is made aware, and the
vape is disposed of offsite by the supervisor. Staff 5 reported she
had no knowledge of any youth having a marijuana blunt at the
facility or youth having access to alcohol. Staff 5 denied telling
any youth about any youth having a marijuana blunt at the facility
or about youth having “buzz balls”. Staff 5 denied Youth B and
Youth E ever going AWOL on her shift and obtaining alcohol.
Staff 5 reported Youth B and Youth E did AWOLP and got alcohol
however Staff 5 reported she heard this from another staff but was
unable to recall which staff. Staff 5 denied ever telling Youth A
about any youth obtaining alcohol at the facility. Staff 5 reported
she heard from another staff, unable to recall which staff, Youth B
had obtained alcohol from an office and as a result Youth B was
no longer allowed at the Spectrum main office. Staff 5 reported
she had no knowledge of alcohol being at the Spectrum main
office. Staff 5 denied any knowledge of Youth B breaking into a
staff‘s car at the facility. Staff 5 reported she did not know if it was
required for staff car doors to be locked when at the facility,
however Staff 5 reported she always locks her car doors. Staff 5
7

said youth are not allowed into other youth’s bedrooms at the
facility, however, youth do not listen and will go into one another’s
bedrooms. Staff 5 reported staff will ask the youth to leave other
youth’s bedrooms however frequently the youth do not listen, and
staff will fine the youth for not following directions, meaning the
youth will lose some of their allowance. Staff 5 reported youth will
sometimes close the doors and lock the doors when in one
another’s bedrooms and staff will unlock the door and remind
youth they need to leave the bedroom. Staff 5 reported staff
typically will remain in the doorway and watch if the youth refuse
to leave the bedroom and continue to ask the youth to leave. Staff
5 reported she has no knowledge of any youth trying to break into
the staff office. Staff 5 reported Youth B took a staff’s keys when
the staff had their keys sitting on the table near the staff. Staff 5
reported Youth B used the staff’s keys to get into the staff office
and take a bag of chips. Staff 5 reported she did not know who
the staff was.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 6/3/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported Youth A
never disclosed any information to her regarding Youth A being
assaulted by other youth at the facility or anything about being
forced by other youth to vape. Staff 6 reported she heard hearsay
from other staff, unable to recall specifically who, a former youth
months ago, had a vape at the facility, however Staff 6 reported
she has never caught or found any youth with any vapes. Staff 6
reported no knowledge of any recent concerns with vapes at the
facility. Staff 6 reported if a vape is found at the facility, the vape is
taken away, an incident report is completed, and the vape is
disposed of by Program Manager or Chief Administrator off site.
Staff 6 reported youth are searched when they return from school.
She said staff search youth at the door when the youth return from
school and check the youth’s backpacks, purses, have the youth
empty their pockets, and “pop their bra” to ensure the youth is not
hiding any items they are not supposed to have. Staff 6 did not
have knowledge of any youth having a marijuana blunt at the
facility. Staff 6 reported she has no knowledge of any youth
obtaining alcohol at the facility. She said she heard Youth B went
into Staff 1’s car. Staff 6 reported she had just arrived at work and
Staff 1 was off grounds on a medical appointment. Youth B came
in the house through the side door and reported she had just been
in Staff 1’s car. Staff 6 reported she had no knowledge of Youth B
taking anything from Staff 1’s car. Staff 6 reported staff car doors
are to always be locked. Staff 6 reported she did not know if Staff
1’s car doors were locked as she did not go out and check after
Youth B had reported she had been in Staff 1’s car. Staff 6
8

reported she has no knowledge regarding any youth obtaining
alcohol from the main Spectrum office. She said youth are not
supposed to be in one another’s bedrooms. Youth do go into
each other’s bedrooms and staff tell the youth they need to leave
the bedroom if it is not their assigned bedroom. Staff 6 reported
youth typically do not care and will remain in their peers’ bedroom
even after staff have told them to leave. Staff 6 reported youth will
close the bedroom door when their peers are in their bedroom and
staff will reopen the door. Staff 6 reported staff do not stay in the
doorway if youth are in one another’s rooms and are not supposed
to be. Staff 6 reported she has never witnessed any youth vape in
their bedrooms. She said she heard all the youth were planning to
go AWOLP together, however only Youth B and Youth E ended
up going. Staff 6 reported she had no knowledge of Youth B and
Youth E attempting to get Youth A to go AWOLP with them. Staff
6 reported she had no knowledge of youth getting any alcohol
while AWOLP.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 6/3/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported no
knowledge of any youth in the home assaulting Youth A or making
Youth A vape. Staff 2 reported she has never seen any youth with
vapes at the facility. If a youth is found to have a vape, staff try to
take the vape and will ask the youth for the vape. Staff 2 reported
youth are checked upon returning from off grounds activities
including school which consists of staff checking the youth’s
backpacks and having the youth “pop their bras” to ensure the
youth are not hiding anything. Staff 2 reported she has no
knowledge of any youth having a marijuana blunt in the home.
Staff 2 reported she heard from Staff 5 that youth, specifically
Youth B, were obtaining alcohol from having people pull up
outside the house and leaving alcohol and obtaining alcohol while
AWOLP. Staff 2 reported she was informed by Staff 5 while the
youth were at the Spectrum main office, Youth B took alcohol from
a staff office refrigerator. Staff 2 reported never saw alcohol at the
Spectrum main office, however Staff 2 reported she has never
gone into the refrigerator or the staff coffee area. Staff 2 reported
she has never seen youth vaping in their bedrooms or in the
home. She said youth are not supposed to be in one another’s
bedrooms however youth do. Staff 2 reported when youth are in
one another’s bedrooms, staff will ask the youth to leave the
bedroom but the youth often refuse. Staff 2 reported staff will fine
the youth meaning a deduction in their allowance for not listening
to staff direction. Staff 2 reported staff cannot make youth leave
one another’s bedrooms. Staff 2 reported when she is working
and youth refuse to leave a bedroom they are not supposed to be
9

in, she will stand in the door for a little while and ask the youth to
leave, if the youth does not leave she will walk away to give the
youth a few minutes, and then come back and ask the youth to
leave again, if the youth continues to refuse to leave, she will fine
the youth. Staff 2 reported she heard from Staff 5 a youth went
into Staff 1’s car and took something however she did not recall
who the youth was and what the youth took. Staff 2 reported
Youth A informed her Youth B and Youth E attempted to get
Youth A to go AWOLP with them however Youth A told Youth B
and Youth E “no”.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on 6/3/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 7 reported no
knowledge of any youth assaulting Youth A or any youth
pressuring Youth A to vape. Staff 7 reported Youth B and Youth C
have been getting vapes from school and bring vapes back to the
facility. Staff 7 has not seen any vapes at the facility, however,
heard Youth C was recently found with a vape during a room
search. She was not present when this occurred, however, heard
about it from Staff 3. Staff 7 reported staff check youth’s
backpacks upon youth returning from school and if a youth is
suspected of having something they are not supposed to have, a
pat check may be completed. Staff 7 reported Staff 3 told her she
saw a vape in the house and thought Youth B was using the vape
in the bathroom. Staff 7 said if a vape is found in the home, the
vape is taken, an incident report is completed, and the Program
Manager and/or Chief Administrator are notified. Staff 7 reported
she did not know how the vape is disposed of. She has never
seen any youth with a marijuana blunt in the home. Staff 7
reported Youth B will say she “smoke a blunt” at school and has
appeared to return from school under the influence of marijuana.
She said when youth, including Youth B, have returned from
school and appear to be under the influence of something, staff
monitor the youth and attempt to keep the youth’s behaviors
minimal. Staff 7 reported she heard about an incident at the
Spectrum office building when the youth went for group where
Youth B went into an office and found alcohol and put it in her
water bottle. Staff 7 reported Youth B appeared drunk, and she
witnessed Youth B’s behavior firsthand. Staff 7 informed Program
Manager. To her knowledge the alcohol was whiskey, and it
came from “a head guy’s office”. Staff 7 reported she believed
she wrote an incident report regarding the situation. Staff 7
reported she has heard times when youth have gone AWOLP and
obtained alcohol while AWOLP but did not have any specific
information regarding this. She was not at the house when Youth
B went into Staff 1’s car however she heard about it. Staff 7
10

reported she heard Youth B found the end of a marijuana blunt in
Staff 1’s car but did not know what or if it was true and/or if Youth
B was able to get into Staff 1’s car. Staff 7 reported staff vehicle
doors are supposed to be locked at the house. Staff 7 reported
youth are not allowed in one another’s bedrooms however it is a
rule that staff are not able to maintain at the facility. Staff 7
reported staff will tell the youth to leave the bedroom but youth
typically refuse as there is no consequence other than youth being
fined on their allowance for not following staff direction. Staff 7
reported when she is working, if a youth is in a bedroom they are
not supposed to be in, she will ask the youth to leave the
bedroom, if the youth refuses, Staff 2 reported she will walk away
for a few minutes and come back and request the youth leave the
room again. Staff 7 reported no knowledge of any youth ever
taking any staff’s keys to get into the staff office. Staff 7 reported
Youth B has kicked in the staff office door to take snacks
previously.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 6/11/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported no
knowledge of Youth A being assaulted by any peers while at the
facility. Youth A told her she was pressured into vaping at the
facility by Youth B, Youth C, and Youth E. Youth A also told her
she had used the vape with Youth B, Youth C, and Youth E and
Youth C had a vape hidden in her bedroom. Staff 3 reported she
completed a room search and located a vape in Youth C’s sock
drawer and the vape was taken and disposed of. Youth A
disclosed to her that she gave in to peer pressure and never
reported anything regarding her being held down and forced to
vape. Staff 3 reported youth are not allowed to vape while at the
facility and the staff complete searches of youth upon youth
returning to the facility from school and off-ground activities. Staff
3 said youth backpacks and purses are searched upon youth
returning to the facility as well as youth removing their shoes to
ensure nothing is hidden in their shoes and youth pop their
bras/shake out their clothing to ensure nothing is hidden on their
person. Staff 3 reported after youth’s backpacks are checked, the
backpacks are kept in the staff office. Frequent room searches
are conducted at the facility as well to ensure the youth do not
have any items they are not allowed to have as the facility is an
open program and youth attend school off site. Staff 3 reported
she has never witnessed any youth using a vape at the facility
however heard from a staff, unable to recall who, Youth B, Youth
C, and Youth E had been caught vaping in their bedroom. Staff 3
reported no knowledge of youth vaping in the bathroom at the
facility. She has never seen or heard anything about any youth
11

having any drugs at the facility including a marijuana blunt. Staff 3
reported she had no knowledge of any youth obtaining alcohol at
the facility and never heard anything about Youth B obtaining
alcohol at the Spectrum main office. She heard Youth B and
Youth E went into Staff 1’s car and took lip gloss. Staff 3 reported
she never heard anything about Youth B and Youth E obtaining
any vapes, marijuana, or alcohol from Staff 1’s car. Staff 3
reported staff are supposed to keep their car windows up and
doors locked when at the facility. Staff 3 reported she heard a
youth, unable to recall what youth or who she heard it from, broke
into the staff office and took something. Staff 3 reported she did
not know what the youth took from the staff office. Staff 3 had no
knowledge of any youth ever getting staff keys and getting into the
staff office. Staff 3 reported youth are not allowed in one another’s
bedrooms, however when this occurs, staff redirect the youth to
come out. She said if the youth refuse to come out of the
bedroom they are not supposed to be in, staff document the
refusal and continue to complete more frequent checks and
redirect youth to leave the bedroom and come into the main area
to hang out. Staff 3 reported she has never observed any youth at
the facility to be under the influence of any substances.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
6/11/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief
Administrator reported youth are not allowed to vape while placed
at the facility. The facility staff complete searches upon youth
returning from offsite school which includes staff looking through
youth’s backpacks and purses, have youth remove their shoes,
empty their pockets, pop their bra, and shake out their clothing to
ensure no items are hidden on the youth’s person. Chief
Administrator reported the facility is an open program and youth
attend school off site which allows youth the opportunity to be able
to obtain contraband they are not supposed to have such as
vapes. Chief Administrator reported vapes have been found at
the facility which were nicotine vapes. She said there has not
been any drugs or drug paraphernalia found at the facility and if
there was, law enforcement would be contacted. Chief
Administrator reported no knowledge of any youth, including
Youth B, having a marijuana blunt at the facility. She reported
when nicotine vapes are found, the vape is taken by staff and
disposed of either at the main office or the dumpster at the facility.
Chief Administrator reported the facility does not have any specific
policy written stating staff must keep their car doors locked at the
